intro: Sicyos erostratus, commonly known as the rough-seeded gourd, is a species of flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that give way to rough, ridged fruits. Its fruit is typically harvested when mature for culinary or ornamental purposes. Sicyos erostratus is adapted to warm climates and thrives in well-drained soil.
